etymology.description: 说(說) (shuō, "speak") and 话(話) (huà, "word; speech") combine to convey the act of speaking or having a conversation, reflecting the direct action of producing words.
etymology.interpretation: The combination suggests the action of using words (话/話) to express verbally (说/說), fitting the meaning of speaking or having a conversation.

examples.chinese: 请小声说话(請小聲說話)。
他善于说话(他善於說話)，能让气氛活跃(能讓氣氛活躍)。
examples.pinyin: tā shànyú shuōhuà, néng ràng qìfēn huóyuè.
examples.english: He is good at speaking and can liven up the atmosphere.

examples.chinese: 小朋友们说话时(小朋友們說話時)，要注意礼貌(要注意禮貌)。
examples.pinyin: xiǎopéngyǒu men shuōhuà shí, yào zhùyì lǐmào.
examples.english: When children speak, they should pay attention to manners.
